articles.title: LLM-FSM: Scaling Large Language Models for Finite-State Reasoning in RTL Code Generation
articles.summary: arXiv:2602.07032v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Finite-state reasoning, the ability to understand and implement state-dependent behavior, is central to hardware design. In this paper, we present LLM-FSM, a benchmark that evaluates how well large language models (LLMs) can recover finite-state machine (FSM) behavior from natural-language specifications and translate it into correct register transfer-level (RTL) implementations. Unlike prior specification-to-RTL benchmarks that rely on manually co

articles.title: ST-Raptor: An Agentic System for Semi-Structured Table QA
articles.summary: arXiv:2602.07034v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Semi-structured table question answering (QA) is a challenging task that requires (1) precise extraction of cell contents and positions and (2) accurate recovery of key implicit logical structures, hierarchical relationships, and semantic associations encoded in table layouts. In practice, such tables are often interpreted manually by human experts, which is labor-intensive and time-consuming. However, automating this process remains difficult. Exi

articles.title: DLLM-Searcher: Adapting Diffusion Large Language Model for Search Agents
articles.summary: arXiv:2602.07035v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recently, Diffusion Large Language Models (dLLMs) have demonstrated unique efficiency advantages, enabled by their inherently parallel decoding mechanism and flexible generation paradigm. Meanwhile, despite the rapid advancement of Search Agents, their practical deployment is constrained by a fundamental limitation, termed as 1) Latency Challenge: the serial execution of multi-round reasoning, tool calling, and tool response waiting under the ReAct

articles.title: Aster: Autonomous Scientific Discovery over 20x Faster Than Existing Methods
articles.summary: arXiv:2602.07040v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce Aster, an AI agent for autonomous scientific discovery capable of operating over 20 times faster than existing frameworks. Given a task, an initial program, and a script to evaluate the performance of the program, Aster iteratively improves the program, often leading to new state-of-the-art performances. Aster's significant reduction in the number of iterations required for novel discovery expands the domain of tractable problems to in

articles.title: Theory of Space: Can Foundation Models Construct Spatial Beliefs through Active Exploration?
articles.summary: arXiv:2602.07055v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Spatial embodied intelligence requires agents to act to acquire information under partial observability. While multimodal foundation models excel at passive perception, their capacity for active, self-directed exploration remains understudied. We propose Theory of Space, defined as an agent's ability to actively acquire information through self-directed, active exploration and to construct, revise, and exploit a spatial belief from sequential, part

articles.title: ANCHOR: Branch-Point Data Generation for GUI Agents
articles.summary: arXiv:2602.07153v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: End-to-end GUI agents for real desktop environments require large amounts of high-quality interaction data, yet collecting human demonstrations is expensive and existing synthetic pipelines often suffer from limited task diversity or noisy, goal-drifting trajectories. We present a trajectory expansion framework Anchor that bootstraps scalable desktop supervision from a small set of verified seed demonstrations. Starting from each seed, we identify

articles.title: Bringing ChatGPT to GenAI.mil
articles.summary: OpenAI for Government announces the deployment of a custom ChatGPT on GenAI.mil, bringing secure, safety-forward AI to U.S. defense teams.

articles.title: Testing ads in ChatGPT
articles.summary: OpenAI begins testing ads in ChatGPT to support free access, with clear labeling, answer independence, strong privacy protections, and user control.

articles.title: Making AI work for everyone, everywhere: our approach to localization
articles.summary: OpenAI shares its approach to AI localization, showing how globally shared frontier models can be adapted to local languages, laws, and cultures without compromising safety.

articles.title: GPT-5 lowers the cost of cell-free protein synthesis
articles.summary: An autonomous lab combining OpenAI’s GPT-5 with Ginkgo Bioworks’ cloud automation cut cell-free protein synthesis costs by 40% through closed-loop experimentation.

articles.title: Introducing Trusted Access for Cyber
articles.summary: OpenAI introduces Trusted Access for Cyber, a trust-based framework that expands access to frontier cyber capabilities while strengthening safeguards against misuse.
